gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components
Interface ISparseArray3D

All Superinterfaces:
IPointList3D, IVirtualArray
All Known Subinterfaces:
IPhysicalArray3D
All Known Implementing Classes:
PhysicalArray3D, SparseArray3D
public interface ISparseArray3D
extends IPointList3D

This interface extends IPointList3D to include values for scattered three dimensional points. The size of a Array must be given by the constructor, but the values may be set later. For each point in the array, there is an associated integer index. The range of the index runs from zero to the total number of points the array can hold. If no positions are given at construction, the points are intitalized as Vector3D objects with Float.NaN for the x, y, and z fields. If no data values are given, they are intialized to Float.NaN. ISparseArray3D is used to hold a collection of three dimensional coordinates with data values that are easy to access. The order of the points may not be important for the code using ISparseArray3D. For example, a 3D Rendering program might use the array to plot points and color them according to their values, and the order of plotting makes no difference on the end result. In addition to data values, the user can set associated error values to each piece of data. The values are initialized to Float.NaN. For quick error setting, square root error approximation may be used.

Method Detail

set

void set(int index,
         Vector3D point,
         float value)
Set a point with data value for single array element.

Parameters:
index - The index of point in array.
point - The 3d coordinates of the point.
value - Value that element will be set to.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().

set

void set(int index_start,
         int index_end,
         Vector3D[] points,
         float[] values)
Sets points with their respective values to array.

Parameters:
index_start - First index of the range.
index_end - Last index of the range.
points - The 3d coordinates.
values - Values for each point.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If given points or values array is smaller than specified range.

getValue

float getValue(int index)
Get value for a single array element based on index.

Parameters:
index - Index of the element.
Returns:
If element is found, the float value for that element is returned. If element is not found, Float.NaN is returned.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().

                  int index_end)
Returns values of specified range of indices.

Parameters:
index_start - First index of the range.
index_end - Last index of the range.
Returns:
A copy of the portion of the array that was specified.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index range goes outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().

getValues

float[] getValues()
Returns all values in the array.

Returns:
A copy of all the data values in the array.

setErrors

boolean setErrors(float[] error_values)
Set the error values that correspond to the data. The size of error array should match the size of the data array. Float.NaN will be left for undersized error arrays. Values that are in an array that exceeds the data array will be ignored.

Parameters:
error_values - The array of error values corresponding to the data.
Returns:
True if error array succesfully matched size of data array.

getErrors

float[] getErrors()
Get the error values corresponding to the data. If no error values have been set, the square-root of the data value will be returned.

Returns:
Copy of error values for the data.

setSquareRootErrors

void setSquareRootErrors(boolean use_sqrt)
Use this method to specify whether to use error values that were passed into the setErrors() method or to use the square-root of the data value.

Parameters:
use_sqrt - If true, use square-root. If false, use set error values if they exist.

getErrorValue

float getErrorValue(int index)
Get an error value for given index. Returns Float.NaN if index is invalid.

Parameters:
index - Index number corresponding to data.
Returns:
Error value for data at specified index. If invalid, Float.NaN is returned.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If index is outside of valid range of indices: 0...getNumPoints().
